private_information: My stack from top to bottom is A B C D E F where A is smallest and F is largest
peg_left.goal: Participate in moving disks so that all disks end up on the right peg in the same top to bottom order A B C D E F following the rules.

peg_middle.goal: Participate in moving disks so that all disks end up on the right peg in the same top to bottom order A B C D E F following the rules.

peg_right.goal: Participate in moving disks so that all disks end up on the right peg in the same top to bottom order A B C D E F following the rules.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem describing the Tower of Hanoi instance and the required planning task so that FastDownward can find a plan that moves all disks from left to right under the rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left middle and right.
There are six disks labeled A B C D E F with A the smallest and F the largest.
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
Never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F. Middle peg empty. Right peg empty.
Goal configuration left peg empty. Middle peg empty. Right peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F.

Using your private information and the public information, report your local stack and enumerate which single-disk moves involving your peg would be legal given only the local visible top disk sizes and the public rules. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a concise structured state description and a list of legal move candidates.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and in preparing planning tasks for the FastDownward planner. Using the reported local states from the pegs, produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance with three pegs named left middle right and six disks A B C D E F. The domain must encode the move-one-disk-at-a-time constraint and the never-place-larger-on-smaller constraint. Ensure types and predicates are clear and suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the three peg state reports and legal move candidates. Integrate that information into a single consistent PDDL domain and problem. The PDDL should encode disks ordered by size with A smallest and F largest, pegs left middle right, an initial state that matches the reported stacks, and a goal with all disks stacked on right in order. Target the FastDownward planner and use constructs compatible with it. Keep actions clear and unambiguous and do not merge agent identities into actions. Provide the final domain and problem.
